content: Just an observation here... If you also use the Allmail folder, remember that it is a duplicate. If you do not need it, I suggest you unsubscribe from it and delete from profile. That will reduce your disk usage and improve overall performance.
creator: davidsk

content: Hi David, The Allmail folder is just a listing of all items, regardless of tags. Deleting from Allmail deletes the item-- it is not really a duplicate. But thanks for the suggestion. Ben
creator: bgrinstein

content: I suggest you review the size of allmail on your harddrive. In gmail, there is only one copy of all messages, but to imitate gmail, thunderbird creates a second copy of all messages. This doubles downloads, sends, and deletes.
creator: davidsk

content:
Since this is for a business, rather than offer a 'fix', I offer a strategy. - I would revert to a version that is stable for your environment - set all copies to NOT update automatically. - if thunderbird is meeting business needs, do NOT update for six months - at six month intervals (or whatever works for you) review release notes of latest update and update one PC. use the update for a minimum of a week on the PC, doing all normal workload tasks. Then, once you're comfortable, update the other PCs.

In essence, treat Thunderbird as any other business tool: don't change just to change. update when the update keeps you eligible for support and when the update adds useful features. For example, 128 is the current release and 115 was the prior release. Requesting help for any version prior to 115 may go unheeded or you will be asked to upgrade immediately. There, just my suggestion, based on my own experience with business software.  :)
creator: davidsk

content:
Informazioni utili da fornire nelle richieste al forum:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
creator: @next

content: As I understand it, you created a new profile and it worked ok, but then copied in the old profile, and problems returned. That indicates the old profile is corrupted in some way. Instead, I would have copied just the local mail into the new profile: copy the mbox files in the old Mail/Local Folders and Mail/<popservername> locations to Mail/Local Folders in the new profile. Add the accounts to the new profile, and copy the abook.sqlite and history.sqlite address book files from the old profile.
creator: sfhowes
